fields.Title of Presentation: Symmetry motivates a new consistent fragment of NF and an extension of NF with semantic motivation
fields.Description/Abstract:
In this paper we introduce a family of theories of sets and classes
motivated by symmetry considerations, indexed by a natural number
parameter.  For the smallest nontrivial value of the parameter we give
a consistency proof of the associated theory, and we show that the
sets of this theory satisfy a fragment of NF not heretofore known to
be consistent, extending both the theory {\em NF$_3$\/} shown to be
consistent by Grishin (\cite{grishin}) and the theory {\em NFSI\/}
recently shown to be consistent by Sergei Tupailo (\cite{tupailo}).
For each larger value of the parameter we obtain a theory whose sets
satisfy {\em NF\/}, and whose comprehension axioms have a semantic
rather than syntactical character.  We have published a paper on a
similar but much more complicated extension of {\em NF\/} earlier
(\cite{symmetry}).
